item.title: Example Blog Installation
item.description:
This is a demonstration installation of the "PluggedOut Blog" script - it's a PHP/MySQL solution for blogs, journals, diaries or any kind of calendar application. It has been developed by a professional software developer - meaning the code is easy to read, light and fast. If nothing else it serves as a good example for people starting out in programming of how to develop a thin client (web) application.

Homepage...
http://www.pluggedout.com/index.php?pk=dev_blog

Demonstration Blog...
http://www.pluggedout.com/blog2dev
or
http://www.pluggedout.com/blog

Support Forum...
Discussion Forum


Feature Overview...

- Multi-User with Roles
- Themes & Templates
- Monthly calendar with hilighted days and navigation controls
- List of recent entries
- Visitor comments against entries
- Verification codes on comments (anti-spam)
- Supports RSS 2
- TimeZone control
- BBCodes
- Plugins/Includes supported
- Full administration interface
- Multi-Lingual Interfaces supported
- Add, edit, remove and publish/unpublish blog entries
- Author entries with a rich text editor inside your browser!
- Change themes
- Edit Template files directly from admin interface
- Upload files for use in entries
- Change settings
- Superb support through the PluggedOut forums
- A well written, stable script by a professional software developer
- Based on rock-solid technologies - MySQL and PHP.

item.title: 1.9.9d gets pushed out the door...
item.description:
This is the development version of the PluggedOut Blog script - it will usually show the latest "in progress" version of the script. At the moment it accurately reflects version 1.9.9d, which is available to download from the development homepage.

I've now shut off the admin area of this installation to prevent people from logging in - it's too much of a security risk (it doesn't take a genius to figure out how to destroy the entire website if you have access to the admin facilities that the admin interface gives you).
item.author: jonbeckett@pluggedout.com

item.title: Testing Plugins
item.description:
Okay... this is a quick test to see if plugins work. I now have an includes directory that you can drop php files in with functions in. If you write a tag into your script in the appropriate format, the tag gets replaced by the results of the function.

[include:hello_world]

Here's another example...

[include:recent_comments]

(and remember - these includes can appear anywhere - in any template, or any post...)

item.title: Getting there...
item.description:
Here's what I've done so far (I'm keeping a note because I'll forget otherwise)

- The blog script now has time adjustment for the displayed blog (meaning you can adjust the apparent times of entries if the server is outside of your own timezone).

- The RSS is fixed so it updates automatically.

- Languages are implemented for the admin interface - meaning it can be re-cast in the admin section just by changing one setting in the config file.

- There is now a security code on the comment form. I need to tweak it a bit to stop idiots from OCRing it.

ummm... I've probably forgotten a few things, but the main thing is it's getting there.
